subject: RE: [junit] TestCase() not public in junit.framework.TestCase
msgSnippet: Thats only the default constructor TestCase() The constructor TestCase(String name) is public and this should be the one you use.. cheers joe ... This e-mail
messageBody:
Thats only the default constructor TestCase()

The constructor TestCase(String name) is public and this should be the one
you use..
cheers
joe

> -----Original Message-----
> From: botartist [mailto:markmc@...]
> Sent: 29 August 2002 05:03
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] TestCase() not public in junit.framework.TestCase
>
>
> I hope someone has seen a similar problem to the following. I would
> appreciate any comments:
>
> Apparently, all testcases (that extend TestCase) must be in the
> junit.framework package. If this is not done, the following compile
> error occurs:
>
> "TestCase() not public in junit.framework.TestCase; cannot be
> accessed from outside package"
>
> I checked the source and the contructor is indeed declared with
> the "default" (none) access modifier.
>
> Surely this can't be an intentional feature. Is this a bug that's
> fixed in 3.8?
>
> (I'm using Junit 3.7 with JDK 1.3.1.04)
>
>
>
>
>
